links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,100
formula: G.f.: Sum_{m>0} m!*x^m/(1-x^m). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 06 2004Inverse Moebius transform of factorials (A000142). - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Mar 19 2006a(n) ~ n!. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 14 2015
example: The divisors of 3 are 1 and 3 so 1!+3!= 7. The divisors of 4 are 1, 2 and 4 so 1!+2!+4!= 27.
prog: (PARI) for(n=0,22,print(sumdiv(n,d,d!)))(PARI) { for (n=0, 100, if (n>0, a=sumdiv(n, d, d!), a=0); write("b062363.txt", n, " ", a) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 06 2009]
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jul 07 2001
